metadata.title: CVE-2024-50214 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/connector: hdmi: Fix memory leak in drm_display_mode_from_cea_vic()modprobe drm_connector_test and then rmmod drm_connector_test,the following memory leak occurs.The `mode` allocated in drm_mode_duplicate() called bydrm_display_mode_from_cea_vic() is not freed, which cause the memory leak:	unreferenced object 0xffffff80cb0ee400 (size 128):	  comm "kunit_try_catch", pid 1948, jiffies 4294950339	  hex dump (first 32 bytes):	    14 44 02 00 80 07 d8 07 04 08 98 08 00 00 38 04  .D............8.	    3c 04 41 04 65 04 00 00 05 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  <.A.e...........	  backtrace (crc 90e9585c):	    [<00000000ec42e3d7>] kmemleak_alloc+0x34/0x40	    [<00000000d0ef055a>] __kmalloc_cache_noprof+0x26c/0x2f4	    [<00000000c2062161>] drm_mode_duplicate+0x44/0x19c	    [<00000000f96c74aa>] drm_display_mode_from_cea_vic+0x88/0x98	    [<00000000d8f2c8b4>] 0xffffffdc982a4868	    [<000000005d164dbc>] kunit_try_run_case+0x13c/0x3ac	    [<000000006fb23398>] kunit_generic_run_threadfn_adapter+0x80/0xec	    [<000000006ea56ca0>] kthread+0x2e8/0x374	    [<000000000676063f>] ret_from_fork+0x10/0x20	......Free `mode` by using drm_kunit_display_mode_from_cea_vic()to fix it.
